item.title: Best Films of 2023
item.description: Top 5 In-Theater Films You know the Stinnetts lead a pretty busy life, whether it’s watching movies, or participating in a Bollywood Dance class, but this year we did make it to quite a few fine films. These are the top 5 in-theater movies of the year! Past Lives Saw this pretty early in the year and it stayed solidly at first place. Great movie with great acting, and an ending full of melancholy.

item.title: Best Films of 2022
item.description: Top 5 In-Theater Films X Super fun horror and well made throw-back horror film. Lots of awesome gory deaths and great characters. Honorable mention for it’s surprise sequel Pearl which didn’t make the top 5, but was still really fun. Babylon One of two amazing movies about the magic of films this year (Shout out to The Fabelmans). Great spectacle and music set in old Hollywood. Excited to see this one again.

item.title: Best Films of 2021
item.description: These are all new films I watched over the last year. To qualify, the film had to be new-to-me, and pretty close to being released in 2021. Top 5 In-Theater Films Pig - Best Nic Cage movie of the year, and contender for best film of the year. Not quite what I was expecting to see, but super beautiful and touching all the way through. In the Heights - First solo movie trip of the year.

item.title: About
item.description: Thanks for stopping by the page! drew@drewlink.com
